titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Leander E. Keck Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Noemi Palomares and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 22:01

did.unittitle: Leander E. Keck Papers
did.abstract: Writings, lectures, course-related materials, and correpondence document the life and work of Leander E. Keck, who served as Dean of the Yale Divinity School from 1979 to 1989 and Winkley Professor of Biblical Theology from 1979, Emeritus as of January 1998.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Leander E. Keck Papers (RG 256), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: For additional biographical documentation, see Series V.

chronitem.event: Study in Kiel and Gottingen, Germany
Assistant Professor, Associate Professor, Professor at Vanderbilt Divinity School
Visiting Professor, Union Theological Seminary, Manila, Philippines
Professor and Chairman of Division of Religion in Graduate School, Emory University
Dean, Winkley Professor of Biblical Theology, Yale Divinity School
Winkley Professor Emeritus of Biblical Theology, Yale Divinity School

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection provides documentation of Leander E. Keck's long career as a New Testament scholar, professor, and theological education administrator. His many speaking engagements, publications, and engagement in the scholarly community are well documented. These are not the official archives of Keck's tenure as Dean of the Yale Divinity School, which are held by the University Archives, but insights into the life of the Divinity School are available in correspondence and course-related materials.

controlaccess.title: Bible. New Testament -- Study and teaching
